author: Chisa Boonmee
title: Air France’s Move Upmarket Awarded Two Prizes
text:
Email 
On 30 June 2015, the Janus du Commerce award was presented to Air France and the Brandimage agency for the high quality, cabin décor and innovative design of the Company’s four new long-haul cabin classes. 
Air France was also awarded Best Design prize for its global approach to design, aimed at offering customers a French-style art of travel combining design and French creation. 
On presenting Air France with the “Janus du Commerce” award, the jury particularly appreciated the genuine increase in comfort, and the new extremely-sophisticated La Première, Business, Premium Economy and Economy cabins. The products and services available in each cabin class have been designed in collaboration with numerous designers (layout of the La Première designer suites, lie-flat seat-beds in Business and seats in Premium Economy and Economy cabins, choice of fabrics, custom-designed tableware, gourmet dining created by starred chefs, a carefully selected wine and Champagne list, a diverse and varied in-flight entertainment offer, etc.). BEST DESIGN PRIZE 
The members of the Janus jury also honoured companies promoting values of design and innovation in France and abroad. Air France received Best Design Prize. A LABEL THAT RECOGNIZES THE BEST IN DESIGN 
Created in 1953, the Janus is a label of excellence that rewards companies and institutions engaged in a process of constant improvement. Today, this label is recognized by professionals and is a benchmark in the world of design, rewarding the best achievements in this area. AIR FRANCE, “WORLD’S MOST IMPROVED AIRLINE” IN 2015 
In June 2015, Air France also received awards from Skytrax, renowned for its highly-professional airline rating and one of the most respected in the global air industry. Air France received two awards – world’s most improved airline and, for the second consecutive year, best first class airline lounge dining. Share this:
